title: Please Explain
body:
I am in B5 and have been promoted to B4 at least a dozen times, however when I get there my lp points take a huge dive going from 20+ in b5 for a win to between 5-12 lp in b4. I still receive the same penalty for a loss, (20-25lp).

Now people will say this is because of my mmr, but I checked this out and my mmr puts me at better than 100% of b5 players. So this makes my mmr at least B4 if not B3. 

So why do I get only as little as 5lp for a win in b4 when my mmr is indicating I am at least at that level?

replies.body:
>Now people will say this is because of my mmr, but I checked this out and my mmr puts me at better than 100% of b5 players. So this makes my mmr at least B4 if not B3.

Your using a 3rd party site, and most of them will not check your entire history but your most recent games, what they say means nothing.

Get to a 50% win rate and you will then start noticing a climb.
Dude the way the point system works I need a 90% win rate to get past b4. Which is just not a reasonable expectation for anybody.
You're counting recent games only. For you to reach a 90% win rate you would have to win more than 1700 games in a row.

If I get out of b5 which I can easy enough if I play properly (as my lp is not stuffed there) then,

to get to promos in b4 I need to win 12 games in a row (which I have done once). So what is your best run of wins in a row in ranked?

You're looking at it wrong. It's not about getting win streaks to climb.  It's about making the system believe that you are of a certain skill level. Getting a lucky 12 streak isn't gonna prove that. Winning more games than you lose will prove that. Yeh, sure, for the moment if you win 2 lose 1 you will continue to lose LP. BUT FORGET ABOUT LP. just win more than you lose and you will slowly climb. 

The key word is SLOWLY. You've played a lot of games so it's gonna take a lot of games to improve your standing. My advice?  Forget about this season, play 100% ONLY to learn and improve for next season

been playing 3 years dude, how slowly you want me to go?

The thing is if I stay in Bronze I won't really improve, as that's all the game offers me. If however I was moved up and down levels(even with extreme fluctuation) at least I would get to play with/against some  better players which in turn would improve my skill level and knowledge of the game. Plus it would give me incentive to try more to be a better player.

At the moment I play champions I like to play more than champions I think i can win with. Which is why I have a poor win rate, as I played support {{champion:267}}  for 40 games and only won 10 of them, apart from that experiment I am pretty much even in my win/loss record. 

I actually have a 27/9 record on {{champion:113}} this year, but I like to play a variety of champions, learn new champions etc. 

And I play mainly support,  so i make it extra difficult for myself anyway, but that's just me, if I manage to get out using the hardest scenario then I would really know the position and the game pretty well don't you think?

> [{quoted}](name=Dungeon Warlord,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=kUReTA2b,comment-id=000200000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-07-15T09:52:29.872+0000)

> At the moment I play champions I like to play more than champions I think i can win with. Which is why I have a poor win rate


I'm not even going to continue this discussion. Why the fuck are you even asking a question? You just answered it yourself.
You are Bronze 5.. With a 46% winrate.. After 461 games.... where are you checking your mmr? pro tip: third party sites are not reliable at estimating mmr.
And I will stay b5 forever when i get 5lp for a win in b4. As it is almost impossible to advance past there while this is happening.
Learn to read. Stop worrying about your LP gains atm, improve your winrate.

I don't really care about winning that much anymore, I haven't even been playing ranked much lately as the queues are too long. I have been playing ARAM as i have 105 champions and would like to complete the set, so I just play to get lp really.

I will make one other point, like this is the lowest level of the game b5 to b4, why would you make it so difficult to move up from that level, I can understand doing it at higher levels, like the higher you go the harder it is to get lp, but doing so at the lowest level is quite frankly discouraging.

My win rate is determined by the team, not just me, and in b5 you get so awesome teammates to deal with at times. 

Like the Fiora who gives 5 kills to top lane in the first 5 minutes, then sits in base the rest of the game. 

Or the guy who wants to play adc and gets 30cs for the whole game.

Like I have been in a game where 4 of us where doing ok and the other guy was just feeding hard, and I thought when he left thank god he did, now at least he isn't feeding the opposition gold and we have a chance. And as it happens the 4 of us took the other 5 down. But some games are just impossible to win and there is nothing at all you could have done better to prevent the loss.


Don't get me wrong I'm sure this happens at all levels. I watched a bit of challenger soloq this week and seen some strange things.

{{champion:29}}  and {{champion:96}} in a team comp, I don't know when that would even make sense.(they got smashed).

A {{champion:104}}  go 1/10/2 in a game, and seeing a jungler from the OCE playing support as the other players in the team are to stubborn to give him his best position, like why would you do that?

its because the mmr system is shit house mate.

You are describing what im bitching about in my own thread two posts below yours.
